{{Infobox person |name = Rosalind Allen |image = |birthname = Rosalind E. Ingledew |birth_date = {{Birth date|1957|9|23}} |birth_place = {{flagicon|New Zealand}} [[New Zealand]] |death_date = |death_place = |occupation = [[Actress]] |yearsactive = 1984â2002 |spouse = Todd Allen
(m.1990-2005, divorced; 1 child)
Miguel Enciso
(m.2006-present) |website = }} '''Rosalind Allen''' (September 23, 1957) is a [[New Zealand]]-born [[actress]] best known for her portrayal [[Physician|Doctor]] [[Wendy Smith (seaQuest DSV)|Wendy Smith]] on [[seaQuest DSV]]'s second season. ==Early life== Born '''Rosalind Ingledew''' in [[New Zealand]] she studied acting there, before moving to the [[United States]]. ==Career== Her movie debut was as an extra in the film ''[[Three Men and a Little Lady]]'', and after guest appearances on a number of daytime dramas dating back to the mid eighties, and a fairly large part in ''[[Children of the Corn II: The Final Sacrifice]]'', as well as several [[independent films]], Rosalind was signed as a main character in [[NBC]]'s popular [[Sci-Fi]] ''[[seaQuest DSV]]'', but she left after one season. Like her ''seaQuest'' predecessor ([[Stephanie Beacham]]), she appeared on an episode of ''[[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]''. Allen also appeared alongside then-husband Todd Allen in ''seaQuest DSV'' in the episode "The Siamese Dream". Allen twice portrayed the love interest of [[Bobby Ewing]] ([[Patrick Duffy]]), though different characters, on both the final episode of the original run of ''[[Dallas (TV series)|Dallas]]'' and the first reunion TV movie ''[[Dallas: J.R. Returns]]''. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Film and Television |- ! Year ! Title !
